result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig C Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig C Reynolds

records.addlTxt: 10:33 Defendant Craig C Reynolds in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Defendant Craig C Reynolds in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No additions, deletions or corrections by Atty Lambert.  Atty Weiland presents a correction to the term of Initial Confinement.  Atty Lambert makes sentence recommendation.  Atty Weiland presents argument on sentence recommendation.  Reynolds makes a statement.  Court addresses Reynolds.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 5, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Craig C Reynolds in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Craig C Reynolds in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
from Atty Kryshak  requesting to reschedule the Jury Trial.
cover letter from Attorney G Kryshak
No contact w/ER or her residence.

Defendant Craig C Reynolds in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Craig C Reynolds in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty pleas entered.    Bond continued.  Atty Kryshak moves to modify bond.  State objects.  Court modifies to $50000 cash bond in 15CF145.

11:01 Defendant Craig C Reynolds in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Craig C Reynolds in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jordan Lubeck is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to dispatch of disturbance on 1st St N on 05/10/13.  Testifies to contact with Eva Rameriz regarding the incident.  Describes the wall where Eva's head made contact and bruises on Eva.  Testifies to contact with Craig Reynolds.  Identifies Craig Reynolds in the courtroom.  

Atty Kryshak cross examines the witness.  Testifies to indentations on the wall.  Identifies bruises on Eva's legs.  

Leonard Lampert is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to dispatch on 05/20/15 to 1st St N regarding a disturbance involving Eva Rameriz and Craig Reynolds.  Testifies to conversation with Eva Rameriz regarding incident.  Describes an "arm bar".  Testifies to conversation with Craig Reynolds.  Identifies Craig Reynolds in the courtroom.  

Atty Kryshak cross examines the witness.  Testifies to the time of the call.  Describes the apartment.  Indicates the marks he witnessed on Eva.  Reynolds was not present when he was at residence. 

Court finds probable cause in both cases and binds the matters over for Arraignment.
No contact w/ER or her residence.
